Name: institution
Value: Observational Health Data Analytics, Janssen Research & Development

Name: coh_chapter_title
Value: Multiple Myeloma, require 2 Dx in 90 days - anchor on 1st, , PL294

Name: coh_definition_description
Value: First occurrence in the patient's history of at least one code for multiple myeloma (not including "in-remission" or "in-relapse" codes), which must be preceded by at least 365 days of prior continuous observation, have a second occurrence of multiple myeloma within the subsequent 90 days, and have exactly zero prior codes indicating history of multiple myeloma or multiple myeloma in remission. Cohort exit is end of continuous observation time.​

Name: coh_development_process
Value: This phenotype was developed within Janssen Research & Development using the CohortDiagnostics tool and PheValuator.

Name: coh_valid_proc_desc
Value: We used PheValuator to estimate this cohort definition's sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value, and F1 in various databases.

Name: coh_valid_data_desc
Value:
IBM MarketScan® Commercial Database (CCAE) [U.S. claims database]
IBM MarketScan® Multi-State Medicaid Database [U.S. claims database]
IBM MarketScan® Medicare Supplemental Database [U.S. claims database]
Optum® De-Identified Clinformatics Data Mart Database – Date of Death (DOD) [U.S. claims database]
Optum® de-identified Electronic Health Record Dataset [U.S. electronic health records database]

Name: coh_add_comms
Value: Note: This definition does not include "in-remission" or "in relapse" codes.
